intro: Parosela seemanii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Parosela seemanii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
